title: Updated contact to Intuit Open Source
body: @thbishop ping

title: Adding support for sending notifications to Slack
create with option --disable-rollback
body: I love simple_deploy but I don't see how to create a stack with that option; can I pass it somehow or is not supported? I need to ssh into my failures to see where the stack ran off the track.

title: list command swallowing errors
body:
I was testing with a new AWS key pair and I kept getting an empty list back with the list command. I finally figured out I had fat fingered the secret key. Once fixed, I got the list of stacks back.

I would expect a bad key pair to raise an error. The empty list coming back is deceiving.

title: only try to read from env when it is desired
body: fixes an issue in which specifying `-e xxx` was still trying to read env vars

title: Catch expired token or bad token error and print friendlier message
body: Currently throws a stack trace: ``` # sd list -r /Users/bweaver/.rbenv/versions/2.0.0-p247/lib/ruby/gems/2.0.0/gems/excon-0.32.0/lib/excon/middlewares/expects.rb:6:in `response_call': Expected(200) <=> Actual(403 Forbidden) (Excon::Errors::Forbidden) response => #"\nExpiredTokenThe security token included in the request is expired50d0fc32-d2e1-479e-8926-d52a0869ea8a", :headers=>{"Transfer-Encoding"=>"", "Date"=>"Wed, 20 Aug 2014 19:55:56 GMT", "Server"=>"Amazon SimpleDB"}, :status=>403, :remote_ip=>"205.251.235.213", :local_port=>59347, :local_address=>"172.28.164.21"}, @body="\nExpiredTokenThe security token included in the request is expired50d0fc32-d2e1-479e-8926-d52a0869ea8a", @headers={"Transfer-Encoding"=>"", "Date"=>"Wed, 20 Aug 2014 19:55:56 GMT", "Server"=>"Amazon SimpleDB"}, @status=403, @remote_ip="205.251.235.213", @local_port=59347, @local_address="172.28.164.21"> ```

title: read config from env vars
body:
this is an alternative implementation to https://github.com/intuit/simple_deploy/pull/235

this basically introduces the `--read-from-env` flag for all commands (with the exception of `environments`). this flag will load 4 aws related env vars to use for the config:
- `AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID`
- `AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY`
- `AWS_SECURITY_TOKEN`
- `AWS_REGION`

you cannot specify both `--read-from-env` and `--environment`. this includes support for temporary credentials.

_note that this implementation does not support notifications._

thoughts?

title: support for env var and aws temporary credentials
body:
this enables both support for specifying credentials using env vars as well as for temporary aws credentials.

the behavior is:
- env vars always override the config file
- you can mix and match env vars and config file values
- use `AWS_SECURITY_TOKEN` (env var) or `security_token` in the config file to leverage temporary credentials
- if either `AWS_SECURITY_TOKEN` or `security_token` are found, then it assumes that temporary credentials should be used (and will therefore include the security token in calls to aws)

does this behavior make sense from a user perspective? what sucks?

title: Skip nested stack if status is deleted
body: In some cases, the nested stack may be deleted but it's still part of stack resources. So need to skip it when listing instances.

title: Updated to include pinned fog-core
body: fog split into fog and fog-core which is breaking our pin to excon.  We are pinning to fog-core 1.21.1.

title: Atributes mapping for ChefRepoUrl
body: Document the mapping of attributes to ChefRepoUrl/AppUrl

title: fog-core 1.22.0 dependency issues
body: The new fog-core library has a dependency of excon = 0.33.0 which conflicts with our gemspec.  We need to pin fog-core to 1.21.1 to avoid this issue.

title: Fix pty option setting in execute command
body: This is a fix for using sudo in execute command. Otherwise you may get "sorry, you must have a tty to run sudo" error.

title: List all instances in a stack
body: A fix for issue #227, list all instances in a stack including nested stack, auto scaling group and EC2 instance.

title: Support nested stack
body: Commands like 'instances' and 'execute' don't support nested stack.

title: Multi asg
body: @brettweavnet-intuit simple_deploy support for Multple ASG's in a stack

title: Stack Updates Wait Too Long
body:
Vinu came by to show a deploy stuck in a backoff loop that was already over 10 backoff iterations. This was the second time I have heard this lately and all I can remember is the backoff running for 5 iterations.

I checked lib/simple_deploy/stack/status.rb and the wait_for_status method had a default count of 25! I acked wait_for_status in the rest of the code and we use the default almost everywhere.

If we aren't going to override the default, we should probably make the default something reasonable like 4-6 iterations.

title: Working code for catching throttle limits and retrying
body:
This is a working branch.  I put it up for discussion so that we can talk about the merits of continuing with fog versus moving to aws-sdk.

There is some expected refactoring since this is the first pass, but I didn't want to optimize if we wanted to pivot to a different task/direction.  Especially if STS is not seeing the problem any longer.

/cc @thbishop @brettweavnet

title: Rev fog
body:
This needs additional testing, but this is to fix the Digest error @capen reported in issue https://github.com/intuit/simple_deploy/issues/221.

I have been using it for a couple days and haven't seen any issues.

/cc @brettweavnet @thbishop @rickmendes

title: update fog to 1.19.0
body:
Users using simple_deploy with ruby >2.1.0 will get verbose deprecation messages from OpenSSL::Digest:

```
 Digest::Digest is deprecated; use Digest
```

This issue is outline [here](http://stackoverflow.com/questions/21184960/ruby-digestdigest-is-deprecated-use-digest) and links to a [fog pull request](https://github.com/fog/fog/pull/2473) in which this issue is fixed and rolled into 1.19.0.

title: Getting started page has bad link
body: [getting started](https://github.com/intuit/simple_deploy/wiki/GettingStarted#getting-started) points to liftoff repo which no longer exists.

title: The Jimmy Flag
body: Added an --external flag to execute, deploy and instances commands.

title: "List" command provides old stacks that are non-existant
body: After running the list command it provides a list of stacks that have been deleted previously (more than 3 weeks).
